bug.summary: [Bug] RandomSharpen returns three channels for one channel input?
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
The RandomSharpen function returns a 3 channel image when a 1 channel input is given. Is this a bug or expected behavior? I would expect it to return a 1 channel image as well. <denchmark-h:h2>To Reproduce</denchmark-h>
Steps to reproduce the behavior: This example is taken directly from: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kornia/kornia/blob/master/kornia/augmentation/augmentation.py#L1053>https://github.com/kornia/kornia/blob/master/kornia/augmentation/augmentation.py#L1053</denchmark-link>
>>> rng = torch.manual_seed(0) >>> input = torch.rand(1, 1, 5, 5) >>> sharpness = RandomSharpness(1.) >>> sharpness(input) tensor([[[[0.4963, 0.7682, 0.0885, 0.1320, 0.3074], [0.6341, 0.7720, 0.9537, 0.7566, 0.6323], [0.3489, 0.7325, 0.5629, 0.6284, 0.2939], [0.5185, 0.8648, 0.9106, 0.6249, 0.2823], [0.6816, 0.9152, 0.3971, 0.8742, 0.4194]], <BLANKLINE> [[0.4963, 0.7682, 0.0885, 0.1320, 0.3074], [0.6341, 0.7720, 0.9537, 0.7566, 0.6323], [0.3489, 0.7325, 0.5629, 0.6284, 0.2939], [0.5185, 0.8648, 0.9106, 0.6249, 0.2823], [0.6816, 0.9152, 0.3971, 0.8742, 0.4194]], <BLANKLINE> [[0.4963, 0.7682, 0.0885, 0.1320, 0.3074], [0.6341, 0.7720, 0.9537, 0.7566, 0.6323], [0.3489, 0.7325, 0.5629, 0.6284, 0.2939], [0.5185, 0.8648, 0.9106, 0.6249, 0.2823], [0.6816, 0.9152, 0.3971, 0.8742, 0.4194]]]]) <denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior</denchmark-h>
Output should only have one channel, i.e. the shape should be (1, 1, 5, 5) not (1, 3, 5, 5). >>> rng = torch.manual_seed(0) >>> input = torch.rand(1, 1, 5, 5) >>> sharpness = RandomSharpness(1.) >>> sharpness(input) tensor([[[[0.4963, 0.7682, 0.0885, 0.1320, 0.3074], [0.6341, 0.5845, 0.9156, 0.5565, 0.6323], [0.3489, 0.5125, 0.2034, 0.3228, 0.2939], [0.5185, 0.7537, 0.8371, 0.3164, 0.2823], [0.6816, 0.9152, 0.3971, 0.8742, 0.4194]]]]) <denchmark-h:h2>Environment</denchmark-h>
